sen.j: 玉松 真広（たままつ まひろ、文化 (元号)7年3月17日 (旧暦)（1810年4月20日） - 明治5年2月15日 (旧暦)（1872年3月23日））は幕末期の国学者。
sen.e: Mahiro TAMAMATSU (April 20, 1810 – March 23, 1872) is a scholar of Japanese classical literature at the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 阿野家の分家である山本家の山本公弘の二男（西園寺家末流）として生まれ、醍醐無量寿院において出家得度し、戒名を猶海とした。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Kimihiro YAMAMOTO of the Yamamoto family (the descendants of Saionji family), a branch family of the Abe clan, and became a priest and took the tonsure at Daigomuryoju-in Temple, to name his Kaimyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) 猶海.

sen.j: 大僧都法印に任ぜられたが、寺中の綱紀粛清をつよく唱えたために反感を買い、1839年還俗。
sen.e: Although he was appointed to Daisozu hoin (a high-ranking priest of Buddhism), he provoked antipathy because he had strongly claimed to tighten official discipline of the temple, and returned to secular life in 1839.
sen.cmt: 「大僧都+法印」と思われますので、Daisozu hoinとし、’仏教の高位の僧’という説明を加えました。

sen.e: He studied in Kyoto under Takamasa OKUNI, a scholar of Japanese classical literature, but soon returned to Izumi Province, confronted with him, to live in seclusion in Mano of Omi Province.

sen.j: ことに有名なのは小御所会議の席上示された王政復古の勅を起草したことであろう。
sen.e: Especially what made him famous can be that he made the draft of the imperial order for the Restoration of Imperial Rule which was presented at the Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace at the night of December 9, 1867, when the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was issued).

sen.j: さらに玉松は、早晩幕府との交戦があることを予想し、官軍の士気を鼓舞するための錦の御旗のデザインを考案するなど、その功績小ならざるものがあった。
sen.e: In addition, Tamamatsu prediced a war is likely to occur between the government sooner or later and developed a design of the Imperial standard (made of gold brocade) in order to encourage the fighting spirit of the imperial army, and so on, and thus his achievements were less than small.

Furthermore, he made less than small achivements including that he predicted a war would occur between the bakufu (shogunate) and the imperial government sooner or later, and developed a flag design of the Imperial standard (made of gold brocade) in order to encourage the fighting spirit of the imperial army.

sen.j: 王政復古の後は、内国事務局権判事となり、平田銕胤らと結んで大学寮（漢学所）を国学を中心とする大学官に併合することを求めるなど、きわめて保守的な立場に立ち、徐々に岩倉らとの距離を深めた。
sen.e: After the Restoration of Imperial Rule was achieved, he became an internal office judge and took an extremely conservative stance, for example, together with Kanetane HIRATA, he required Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) (Kangakusho [the Chinese Learning Place]) be annexed to the 大学官 which centers on the study of Japanese classical literature, and thus gradually deepened the gap between Iwakura and others.
sen.cmt: 「大学官」はネットでも歴史事典にもありませんでしたが、ネットで文科省の‘学制百年史第一編序章二’を見ますと、「同年[明治元年]九月に「皇学所」および「漢学所」が設けられたが、これらも大学創設を理由に翌二年九月に廃止された。当時は東京および京都に大学校設立の方針が定められていたが、」とあります。「皇学所」は国学を中心とする学問所のようです。この文科省のウェブサイトにも「大学官」という言葉はありませんので、「皇学所」のことではないかと思われます。http://www.mext.go.jp/b_menu/hakusho/html/hpbz198101/hpbz198101_2_016.html
sen.e: After the Restoration of Imperial Rule was achieved, he became an internal office judge and took an extremely conservative stance, for example, together with Kanetane HIRATA, he required Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) (Kangakusho [the Chinese Learning Place]) be annexed to the Daigakukan which centers on the study of Japanese classical literature, and thus gradually deepened a gap between Iwakura and others.

sen.j: 東京奠都にあたっては猶予願を出し、1870年に東京で大学中博士兼侍読に任ぜられたものの、政府の欧化政策を嫌悪し、同年10月に辞職。
sen.e: On the transfer of the national capital to Tokyo, he submitted a request for the extension for it, and while he was assigned to 大学中博士-cum-Jidoku (imperial tutor) in Tokyo in 1870, he hated the governmental policy of Europeanization and resigned between October and November in the same year.
